arts.ttl: Arsenal target Benjamin Sesko will NOT leave RB Leipzig this month, claims German side's boss Marco Rose
arts.sum: SIMON JONES: The Gunners are in the market for an attacker and Sesko has been considered, but it has been suggested that a summer move may be more appropriate if an approach is made.

arts.ttl: RB Leipzig vs Sporting: Confirmed Lineups, Injuries and Score Prediction
arts.sum: RB Leipzig vs Sporting: Wednesday 22nd January, 17:45 GMT, Red Bull Arena RB Leipzig, languishing near the bottom of the Champions League table, host Sporting, who are in the bottom half of the table...

arts.ttl: Gyokeres scores again but Sporting lose to Leipzig
arts.sum: Sporting's hopes of directly reaching the Champions League knockout stage suffer a blow as they were beaten 2-1 by already-eliminated RB Leipzig in Germany.

arts.ttl: RB Leipzig vs. Bayer Leverkusen: How do they stack up?
arts.sum: As RB Leipzig prepare to welcome Bayer Leverkusen to the Red Bull Arena on Matchday 19, bundesliga.com looks at how the two teams stack up ahead of a potentially season-defining fixture for both teams on Saturday. Leipzig inflicted Leverkusen’s first Bundesliga loss in 35 games when they came away from the BayArena with a 3-2 win, thanks to a Loïs Openda double after Kevin Kampl had initially got them back into the game from being 2-0 down.

arts.ttl: Venezia Explores Andre Silva as Potential Replacement for Departing Pohjanpalo
arts.sum: Venezia are seeking to reinforce their attacking options in the January transfer window, with Portuguese striker Andre Silva emerging as an intriguing potential addition to the squad. The post Venezia Explores Andre Silva as Potential Replacement for Departing Pohjanpalo appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Sporting fall to third straight Champions League defeat with 2-1 loss in Leipzig
arts.sum: Sporting’s hopes of a top-eight finish and automatic qualification for the round of 16 in the Champions League went up in smoke in after a 2-1 defeat in Leipzig this evening. The German side, who had not earned a single point until tonight, took the lead through Benjamin Sesko and had another goal ruled out for offside in a dominant first half. Sporting looked a different team when Viktor Gyökeres, Daniel Bragança and Hidemasa Morita came off the bench ten minutes into the second half, and equalised through the inevitable Gyökeres. But poor defending allowed Poulsen to quickly restore Leipzig’s lead and there was no way back for Sporting. More to follow.

arts.ttl: Shakhtar beats Brest to stay in Champions League contention. Sporting Lisbon loses at Leipzig
arts.sum: The French club was 11th at the final whistle with 13 points and could yet qualify direct for the round of 16 with a top-eight finish, though it plays defending champion Real Madrid next Wednesday. Shakhtar now has seven points from seven games, one below the current tally of Manchester City in 24th place before seven games are played later Wednesday.

arts.ttl: Leipzig battle for pride as Poulsen downs Sporting Lisbon
arts.sum: Leipzig played host to Sporting Lisbon this evening with mere pride to play for. Goals from Benjamin Sesko and Yusuf Poulsen sealed a 2-1 win.
